column5: As a novice Fly Fisherman ... is there anyone out there with helpful hints on this subject???
Just tie on a 1/4, 3/8, or 1/2oz jig and you'll be fine. Dressing it with a minnow or leach can be deadly! I'll stand clear of the first cast...zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

Try small to medium rivers with good populations of walleye. Low light is the key , just before dark walleye start to move very shallow onto rock riffle areas to feed. Fish as late as you feelcomfortable doing, minnow and crayfish patterns should work.
Blue Sky, Fact is I have no earthly clue and couldn't resist having some fun. I'm a bottom bouncing jigging nut and would some day like to learn the art of fly fishing! Good luck!

I spent 8 days in Nakina on a fly-in the first week of June. I am an avid fly fisherman in NC for trout. I took some advice from a local outfitter here in NC an tied on a steel leader and a large salt water fly attempting to catch pike. On my third cast I broke my 6 weight G. Loomis GL3 rod. My advice, watch the weight of your rig!!! By the way, I promptly put away my other fly rod.
